intro: Swainsona pyrophila, commonly known as the flame tree, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It is characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant is a legume, belonging to the Fabaceae family, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Swainsona pyrophila is adapted to fire-prone environments, often regenerating after bushfires. Its rapid growth and showy flowers make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
